intro: Coccoloba moritzii var. opaca, commonly known as the velvetleaf coral tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Its unique foliage and adaptability make it a notable species in horticulture and ecological studies.
